data.title: Once Upon A Planet
data.meta_description: Science fiction writers have been dreaming up planets - and aliens - for years. But recently, astronomers have discovered hundreds of planets far beyond our solar system. Is there life on those planets, too? In fact and in fiction, Stephen Humphrey explores our need to know that we're not alone in the cosmos....
data.text:
Science fiction writers have been dreaming up planets - and aliens - for years. But recently, astronomers have discovered hundreds of planets far beyond our solar system. Is there life on those planets, too? In fact and in fiction, Stephen Humphrey explores our need to know that we're not alone in the cosmos.

Reading List:

Non-Fiction:

Jayawardhana, Ray. Strange New Worlds. Harper Collins Publishers Ltd., 2011.

Cohen, Jack and Ian Stewart. What Does A Martian Look Like? The Science of Extraterrestrial Life. John Wiley and Sons Inc., 2002.

Pratchett, Terry, Jack Cohen and Ian Stewart. The Science of Discworld IV. Ebury Press , 2013.

Benford, Gregory and James Benford (Editors). Starship Century: Toward the Grandest Horizon. Lucky Bat Books, 2013.

Shostak, Seth. Confessions of an Alien Hunter: A Scientist's Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence. National Geographic, 2009.

Impey, Chris (Editor). Talking About Life: Conversations on Astrobiology. Cambridge University Press, 2010.

Bell, Jim. The Space Book: From the Beginning to the End of Time, 250 Milestones in the History of Space & Astronomy. Sterling. 2013.

Science Fiction:

Sawyer, Robert J. Far-Seer: Book One of the Quintaglio Ascension. Tor Books, 2004.

Sawyer, Robert J. Red Planet Blues. Ace Hardcover, 2013.

Benford, Gregory. The Martian Race. Aspect, 1999.

Benford, Gregory. Anomalies. Lucky Bat Books, 2012.

Stewart, Ian and Jack Cohen. Wheelers. Warner Books, 2000.

Lem, Stanislaw. Solaris. Faber and Faber, 1961.
